doc.name: revXMLRPC_GetHost
doc.summary: This function returns the target host of an XML-RPC document.

description.p: Use the revXMLRPC_GetHost function to retrieve the host that is the target of the execution of an XML-RPC request.
The documentID is the number returned by the revXMLRPC_CreateRequest when you created the XML-RPC request, or the successful revXMLRPC_Execute function when you executed an XML-RPC request.
The revXMLRPC_GetHost function returns the IP address or domain name of the host that is the target of the XML-RPC document.
If the revXMLRPC_GetHost function encounters an error, it returns an error message starting with "xmlrpcerr"..

Important! The revXMLRPC_GetHost function is part of the XML-RPC library. To ensure that the function works in a standalone application, you must include this custom library when you create your standalone. In the Inclusions section on the General screen of the Standalone Application Settings window, make sure "XML-RPC Library" is selected in the list of script libraries.
